subprocess_flow.description: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) is responsible for coordinating and preparing the logistics for the PI Planning event. This includes scheduling the event, booking the venue, arranging for necessary equipment (projectors, whiteboards, collaboration tools), and communicating the event details to all participants. Ensuring smooth logistics is crucial for a productive and efficient PI Planning session.
success_criteria: PI Planning event is scheduled and confirmed
Participants are informed of event details
subprocess_flow.purpose: Ensure all logistical aspects of PI Planning are in place for a smooth event.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Book venue well in advance and have backup options

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to logistics require RTE approval
change_management.versioning_rules: Track changes to schedule and venue

subprocess_flow.description: Product Management reviews the program backlog with key stakeholders to ensure it is prioritized and reflects the current business needs. This involves refining user stories, defining acceptance criteria, and estimating story points. A well-groomed backlog ensures that teams have clear and actionable items to plan during PI Planning.
success_criteria: Program backlog is prioritized and refined
User stories have clear acceptance criteria
subprocess_flow.purpose: Ensure the program backlog is ready for teams to plan their iterations.
end_conditions: Program backlog is reviewed and prioritized

step_risks_and_controls.control: Regular backlog refinement sessions with stakeholders

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to backlog require Product Management approval
change_management.versioning_rules: Track changes to user stories and priorities

subprocess_flow.description: Business Owners and Product Management present the current business context, strategic vision, and top priorities to the Agile Release Train (ART). This provides teams with the necessary information to make informed decisions during planning. A clear understanding of the business context is essential for aligning team efforts with overall business goals.
success_criteria: Business context and vision are clearly communicated
subprocess_flow.purpose: Provide teams with the necessary context to align their planning with business goals.
end_conditions: Business context and vision are presented

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to vision require Business Owner approval

subprocess_flow.description: Teams break out to plan their individual iterations for the upcoming Program Increment (PI). This involves selecting user stories from the program backlog, identifying dependencies, and estimating the work required. Effective team breakout sessions are crucial for creating realistic and achievable iteration plans.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Enable teams to create detailed plans for their iterations within the PI.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to iteration plans require team agreement

subprocess_flow.description: Each team presents their draft iteration plans to the rest of the Agile Release Train (ART) for review and feedback. This allows teams to identify potential dependencies and conflicts early in the planning process. Constructive feedback during the draft plan review is essential for ensuring a cohesive and aligned PI plan.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Identify dependencies and conflicts early in the planning process.
end_conditions: Draft plans are reviewed and feedback is provided

step_risks_and_controls.control: Encourage active participation from all teams

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to plans based on feedback require team agreement
change_management.versioning_rules: Track changes to plans based on feedback

subprocess_flow.description: Teams adjust their iteration plans based on the feedback received during the draft plan review. This involves resolving dependencies, addressing conflicts, and ensuring that the plans are realistic and achievable. Making necessary adjustments is crucial for creating a final PI plan that is aligned and executable.
success_criteria: Iteration plans are adjusted based on feedback
subprocess_flow.purpose: Create a final PI plan that is aligned and executable.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to plans require team agreement

subprocess_flow.description: Teams commit to their final iteration plans and provide a confidence vote indicating their level of confidence in achieving the PI Objectives. This provides a transparent view of the ART's overall commitment and identifies potential risks. A high level of commitment and confidence is essential for a successful PI.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Provide a transparent view of the ART's overall commitment and identify potential risks.
end_conditions: Teams commit to plans and confidence vote is conducted

step_risks_and_controls.control: Address concerns and adjust plans as needed

change_management.change_request_process: Changes after commitment require RTE approval
change_management.versioning_rules: Track changes to plans after commitment

subprocess_flow.description: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) creates a program board that visualizes the PI Objectives, dependencies, and risks for the upcoming Program Increment (PI). This provides a clear and transparent view of the overall plan and facilitates communication across teams. A well-maintained program board is crucial for tracking progress and managing dependencies throughout the PI.
success_criteria: Program board is created and visualized
PI Objectives, dependencies, and risks are clearly displayed
subprocess_flow.purpose: Visualize the PI plan and facilitate communication across teams.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to program board require RTE approval

improvement_inputs: Team feedback on program board clarity
